full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 688 Filed 06/29/22 Page 346 of 353 Juror ID: 124 47. Witnesses in this case may testify claiming sexual abuse or sexual assault. Would you have any difficulty assessing the credibility of a witness claiming sexual assault or abuse just like you would any other witness? Yes No If yes, please explain: 48. Have you or a friend or family member ever been the victim of sexual harassment, sexual abuse, or sexual assault? (This includes actual or attempted sexual assault or other unwanted sexual advance, including by a stranger, acquaintance, supervisor, teacher, or family member.) Yes (self) Yes (friend or family member) No If yes, without listing names, please explain: Child molested by an adult If your answer to 48 was yes, do you believe that this would affect your ability to serve fairly and impartially as a juror in this case? Yes No If yes to 48b, please explain: -24- DOJ-OGR-00011099

text_blocks.content: 47. Witnesses in this case may testify claiming sexual abuse or sexual assault. Would you have any difficulty assessing the credibility of a witness claiming sexual assault or abuse just like you would any other witness?

48. Have you or a friend or family member ever been the victim of sexual harassment, sexual abuse, or sexual assault? (This includes actual or attempted sexual assault or other unwanted sexual advance, including by a stranger, acquaintance, supervisor, teacher, or family member.)
If yes, without listing names, please explain:
If your answer to 48 was yes, do you believe that this would affect your ability to serve fairly and impartially as a juror in this case?

additional_notes: The document is a juror questionnaire with handwritten responses. The juror has indicated that they or a family member has been a victim of sexual abuse and has provided a brief explanation. The juror has also indicated that this experience would not affect their ability to serve impartially as a juror.
